ticket_attributes._default_title_: Integration Issue with eMAR and Nourish
ticket_attributes._default_description_: Allergies and resident profiles are disappearing from eMAR after interactions in Nourish, specifically hospital admissions. This issue requires investigation and resolution by the technical services team.

ticket_parts.body: Sorry, as a bot I couldn’t find an answer for that.
You can rephrase your question, or talk to our team
Hi Zoe, could you tell me more? can I have an example?

Hiya,
​

Yes of course, so the allergies that are on our eMAR system are being removed. I have attached two pictures aboce one showing how it appears on Nourish and not then another on eMAR, I have updated eMAR yesterday to reflect the allergies and today it has disappeared again.
​

This has previously happened with picture review dates which no longer appear on eMAR since we have integrated into Nourish which pulls information from our eMAR system.
​

Thanks

Zoe

OK, I wonder if this is to do with when the allergy interaction was completed…

The allergy interactions were created some time ago, in July for one of them.

I know that if you update Med eCare, it will wipe any updates over based on the integration, so that is what is happening.

[~accountid:712020:cb501913-613a-4e2b-8385-9664ad58b69c] - with your knowledge, do you know how the allergies go from Nourish to the Medecare - is this after an interaction has been completed?

For these, (token ID 39767918-5E12-41B4-9315-109AFAC81503) I can see that their allergies were added awhile ago, e.g. before the integration was turned on, so I’m suspicious that allergies are only pulled when an interaction is completed, after the integration has been switched on - but I’m not certain of this. Although that doesn’t seem very sensible, as if allergies are already there, then Med ecare should be pulling them.

[~accountid:712020:65d5077a-264f-46d5-8395-8c1ef574aa27] - I wonder if the customer could add the allergies again via a new interaction, and see if that then works to update Medecare?

on DR-3458: [5783] Maypole Grove | Allergies not syncing to Mede Care (Nourish filled in, Mede Care clears to non)

 Jira · nourishcare.atlassian.net

💬️ Lucy Russell commented

 
As an update to this one, we have found the issue, there is an unexpected value of ‘No’ in the API for these people, for environmental allergies.

The integration has not been built to expect a ‘No’ value, so it’s breaking.

The No value seems to be coming from the ‘Needs assessment’ - but I’m still investigating that part.

In the meantime, Kosi at Med e care is going to update the integration to interpret ‘No’ as ‘None Known’, so the allergies should come through as expected.

Please clarify what the user is trying to do and what steps they are taking in Nourish to ascertain if things are working as expected.

Hi Zoe, apologies for the delay in response.
Regarding the issue with the allergies we have made great progress. We should have it resolved soon. However for the other highlighted issue we will need more information.
When you suspend a resident is it discharging them? Is that what you mean?
If yes can you tell us who did this happened to. Preferably Name initials and room number.
Nourish by default changes the status of the resident to Suspended. So the resident profile would change to the suspended list and show only there. Is it on the archived list instead?

​
Hiya,

Hi Lucy Russell they have included it within this issue. I did request them to put a separate Support ticket through but it doesn't appear they have done this. That said, based on what Carrie has said it seems its normal behavior. Their concern is that the record disappears from the emar.

So if we complete hospital admission they completely disappear from eMAR, it makes that room available to be admitted into and we are not able to see the medication profile. If we fill out the discharge to holiday its fine and the resident still appears on eMAR. Is just the hospital interaction.

I see, the person supported needs to be in Onboarding, Active or Emergency Admission in Nourish for the profile information to synchronise.

If an individual has been Archived/Suspended in Nourish, they will be automatically be Suspended in MED e-care. Therefore when the status changes to Onboarding/Active once again the profile should come back in view.
Is the name of the interaction discharge to holiday ? is that the one you are using ?
Carrie Taylor would the Holiday/Away not work in the same way ?
Ah I see it is the original Holiday/Away correct ?

If a resident who is here and fully onboarded and on nourish and they go into hospital under an admission and we fill out the hospital admission interaction they completely disappear of eMAR, the only way to get them back and on eMAR is to admit back ionto Nourish which something we often need to access when someone is in hospital. med e car have told us that we have to do this in order to see them again.
If they are on holiday and we complete the Holiday/Away intercation they do not disappear off eMAR

I see, thank you for the clarification. I will have to check with the product team if this is in fact intended/agreed functionality.
We will update you as soon as possible. Apologies for the inconvenience.
Carrie Taylor can you confirm ?

Only new profiles in from Nourish should require admission based on the article.

"new residents from Nourish will appear as Pre-Admissions in MED e-care and a room/bed will need to be assigned in MED e-care to admit them into the eMAR system."

https://help.nourishcare.co.uk/en/articles/196748-med-e-care-integration

DR-3813: Mede Care [5783] Maypole Grove - Should suspended disappear from Mede Care

 Jira · nourishcare.atlassian.net

"I assume what they are saying is that they don't want the client to disappear from eMar when they are 'suspended' - as they still want to be able to review the medications. And that they only want the client to disappear from eMar when they are 'archived' in Nourish"

Yes that is correct
thank you Lucy Russell

💬️ Lucy Russell commented

 
This was the response from Med e Care:

Permanent status residents are pre-admitted in MED e-care, this includes "status": "admitted", "status":"emergency_admission" , "status": "onboarding"

All other statuses result in a "Discharge - Return Expected" in MED e-care if they are already admitted.

When residents are discharged, their information is always accessible in MED e-care. The Discharged resident is only excluded from the ongoing medication rounds; once re-admitted they are restored to the correct medication administration rounds. 

Hope this helps, please update me on your findings. 

I don’t think this answers the customer’s question, so I’m trying to see if we can test this out - but I don’t have access to a Med e Care account.

Kosi at med e care can check, I’m just working out which resident to change the status on in our test account.

on DR-3458: Mede Care [5783] Maypole Grove - Allergies not syncing as expected

 Jira · nourishcare.atlassian.net

💬️ Lucy Russell commented

 
Summary

If a customer was using the 'Catheter risk assessment' as part of this assessment in Nourish it asks about environmental and medication allergies.  This assessment was collecting the answer as 'No' and not 'None Known'

The 'No' answer was then wiping out the Med ecare allergy field to empty/allergies not done (as they were expecting 'None Known') - which was incorrect.

We have now resolved this by updating the 'Catheter risk assessment' answer to be 'None known' when completing and we have also updated all the existing 'No' answers in Nourish to be None Known.

Exemplar raised this here and Connaught care also raised it separately - I have emailed Becca Matthews, so she can contact Connaught care to let them know.

We believe this is now resolved.

from DR-3458: Mede Care [5783] Maypole Grove - Allergies not syncing as expected

 Jira · nourishcare.atlassian.net

Hi Zoe, Developers have informed us that this has been resolved now. The allergy in formation should be showing correctly in Med eCare for all clients.

In summary:
​

If a customer was using the 'Catheter risk assessment' as part of this assessment in Nourish it asks about environmental and medication allergies. This assessment was collecting the answer as 'No' and not 'None Known'

The 'No' answer was then wiping out the Med ecare allergy field to empty/allergies not done (as they were expecting 'None Known') - which was incorrect.

We have now resolved this by updating the 'Catheter risk assessment' answer to be 'None known' when completing and we have also updated all the existing 'No' answers in Nourish to be None Known.
Apologies for the inconvenient and for the wait.
Hope you have a lovely day Zoe! =)

Hiya,

So the allergies are documented on nourish, however they are still not showing on the eMAR system. They are appearing on Nourish still. I will continue to look through the residents.

Zoe

UPDATE:

Kosi
I sent over an update probably at the same time as you were sending the steps below. This matches with what I followed for some of the steps but I identified some others. Once I confirm with the team I'll provide an update.

There appears to be multiple workflows at play here and they result is different data in the API to us. I am using postman to see what data we are getting in the API.

I'll get more clarification from the team on what happens in each case. This may well explain why the end user is seeing something different.

  • Suspended via hospital admission 

"status": "suspended",

            "status_start_on": "2023-08-29",

            "status_finish_on": null,

  • Suspended via holiday admission with "Yes" selected for "Is continuing to receive support"

"status": "admitted",

            "status_start_on": "2023-05-03",

            "status_finish_on": null,

·                  Suspended via holiday admission with "No" selected for "Is continuing to receive support"

"status": "suspended",

            "status_start_on": "2025-01-27",

            "status_finish_on": null,

  • Suspended via Status in Organisation

"status": "suspended",

            "status_start_on": "2025-01-27",

            "status_finish_on": null,

·                  Suspended via Status in Organisation with Leave date selected

"status": "suspended",

            "status_start_on": "2025-01-29",

            "status_finish_on": "2025-02-10",

In each case above, if the end user selects a Leave Date in Status in Organisation, the status_finish_on is populated.

on DR-3458: Mede Care [5783] Maypole Grove - Allergies not syncing as expected

 Jira · nourishcare.atlassian.net

💬️ Lucy Russell commented

 
h3. Update:

Suspending a resident in Nourish doesn’t change their state in Med eCare

The ‘leave date’ in Nourish is what impacts if they are discharged in Med eCare - if this is set, then they will be discharged in Med eCare after the date has passed.

(However, there is currently a bug, that if the date is in the future, they are being discharged in Med eCare already - they are going to fix that bug)

Residents do not ‘disappear’ on discharge in Med eCare, they are simply not active for their meds to be given. There are filters in the meds review section to allow the viewing of discharged resident’s medications. Med eCare support can help customers find this if needed.

on DR-3458: Mede Care [5783] Maypole Grove - Allergies not syncing as expected

 Jira · nourishcare.atlassian.net

💬️ Lucy Russell commented

 
Update - spoke to Kosi just now, they have found at their end that if all allergies return as ‘None known’ form the Nourish API, then their side is setting the resident to display as ‘None Entered' - which is incorrect.

They have a fix in progress, it is currently in QA.

Note: he said that previously the ‘No’ was causing it to break where someone did have an allergy in 1 of the categories, e.g. a food allergy, and then another category was ‘No’, this was breaking it, reverting it to ‘None entered’ - so this has already been fixed.

on DR-3458: Mede Care [5783] Maypole Grove - Allergies not syncing as expected

 Jira · nourishcare.atlassian.net

💬️ Lucy Russell commented

 
Summary

Customers reported allergies not showing as expected in Medecare

There were 2 issues -

Instead of ‘None known’ as an answer on one of our interactions, we were passing in ‘No’ which Medecare wasn’t expecting, so was breaking; we fixed the interaction

When all allergies were ‘None known’, then Medecare was recording as ‘None entered’; they fixed this to show as ‘None known’

All now resolved.
